item.title: Matt add a quote by Herodotus
item.description:
"He asked, 'Croesus, who told you to attack my land and meet me as an enemy instead of a friend?'
The King replied, 'It was caused by your good fate and my bad fate. It was the fault of the Greek gods, who with their arrogance, encouraged me to march onto your lands. <b>Nobody is mad enough to choose war whilst there is peace. During times of peace, the sons bury their fathers, but in war it is the fathers who send their sons to the grave</b>." -- Herodotus

item.title: Matt add a quote by Aeschylus
item.description: "A great ox stands on my tongue." -- Aeschylus

item.title: Matt add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Matt add a quote by Werner Herzog
item.description: "What would an ocean be without a monster lurking in the dark? It would be like sleep without dreams." -- Werner Herzog

item.title: Matt add a quote by Werner Herzog
item.description: "Meanwhile it's got stormy, the tattered fog even thicker, chasing across my path. Three people are sitting in a glassy tourist cafe between clouds and clouds, protected by glass from all sides. Since I don't see any waiters, it crosses my mind that corpses have been sitting there for weeks, statuesque. All this time the cafe has been unattended, for sure. Just how long have they been sitting here, petrified like this?" -- Werner Herzog
